content.text:
# Draft:Presidential Drawdown Authority

() is a power exercisable by the President of the United States to order the transfer of military equipment and services from existing United States Department of Defense stocks (drawdown) to a foreign country or international organisation. This special authority was created by the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 Section 506(a)(1). It is exercisable when an unforeseen emergency creates a need for the US to immediately provide foreign military aid, and this need cannot be met using powers provided by any other law, such as the Arms Export Control Act.
References
